title: Recommendations: Allow specifying a content pattern

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
We'd like vscode to automatically recommend the azurerm-vscode-tools extension whenever it sees *.json or *.jsonc files that match the following somewhere in the contents of the file (it's okay if it only checks near the top):
```regex
"\$schema"\s*:\s*"https?:\/\/schema\.management\.azure\.com\/schemas\/[^"\/]+\/(deploymentTemplate|subscriptionDeploymentTemplate)\.json#?"
```
ARM template files are .json files and generally look like this:
{
"$schema": "http://schema.management.azure.com/schemas/xxxx-yy-zz/deploymentTemplate.json#",
"contentVersion": "1.0.0.0",
"parameters": {

The $schema value is the key to knowing if it’s an ARM template (technically it could be anywhere in the file although it’s usually at the top like this).

Here are some sample template files that should match the above regex:
* https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/blob/master/101-storage-account-create/azuredeploy.json
* https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/blob/master/subscription-level-deployments/subscription-role-assigment/azuredeploy.json
* https://github.com/jeffpatton1971/AzureSqlDb/blob/6d98465a80f85994be5b7bbbf820864d735520a1/AzureSqlDb/DeployAzureSQL.json

title: Allow tabs to wrap to multi-line
body:
I almost always have more tabs open than fit in the horizontal space provided. I have seen the thread on shrinking tabs to try to fit them in one line [#15048](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15048), and I've also seen this closed feature request for what I'm asking for - [#32836](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/32836). That issue was closed saying there would be no changes for 6-12 months, and it has been around 15 months now so wanted to reopen discussion.

JetBrains IDEs added this a few years ago - simple config option to wrap open tabs to multiple lines rather than extending indefinitely horizontally, forcing a horizontal scroll or use of the Open Editors section in the left bar. While the Open Editors block is a nice idea, I've spent so many years switching via tabs (and continue to do so in all my other editors) that I'm requesting a better solution.

title: Message "Git not found. Install it or configure it using the 'git.path' setting" received after update to OSX Mojave

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
The git installation is actually there, but probably VScode is having trouble recognising git, because XCode CLI tools needs updating for ti to work properly. Unsure of details. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52522565/git-is-not-working-after-macos-mojave-update-xcrun-error-invalid-active-devel

Perhaps VSCode could offer a slightly more sophisticated check and more verbose error message to point users in the right direction (updating XCode CLI tools, nothing wrong with git)

title: [Debug] Expose the contribution.menus for Variable view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
The Java Debugger extension received much feedback to support customizing the Variable Formatter. For example:
- Show decimal/hex/oct for int.
- Show logical structure for Array/List/Map/Collections.
- Show toString() for Object.

But current VS Code doesn't provide the frontend UI or the protocol for changing the Variable Format dynamically. See the docs here, https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/contribution-points#contributes.menus, it doesn't say the extension could contribute context menus to the debug Variable view.

The request is to expose the contribution.menus for Variable view, and carry the hovered variable `type` info in the menu context. Besides, the DAP should provide some approach to re-request the variable info after dynamically changing the variable format.

title: feature request: API to set URL of WebView
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
Currently the webview API does not allow setting a URL to load content. Thus, if you want to load content from a remote/local server you need to set the webview's html to include an iframe. 

Inserting an iframe inside of a webview breaks all keyboard shortcuts inside the webivew (so no copy / paste) and also outside of the webview (so you cannot open the command palatte)

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
The bugs described above do not occur when an iframe is not inserted within a webview. If we could set the webview's url we would not need an iframe. Thus the feature request is an extension of the webview api to set a url to load content.

title: maintain cursor position when copying lines using ctrl+c, ctrl+v
body:
Copy Line Down (Shift + Alt + DownArrow) maintains cursor position. That's great.

However, copying a line using ctrl+c and ctrl+v (when there is no selection) places the cursor at the beginning of the copied line.

The cursor placement behavior should be consistent between the two methods of copying a line. The cursor position should be maintained in both cases.

title: Race condition with "runOn": "folderOpen" if extension not already activated

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
I had an issue raised at https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/1516 that seems to be a race condition when tasks are set to `"runOn": "folderOpen"`. The issue is that the task is invoked before the extension activates resulting in "The pub task detection didn't contribute a task" (on Windows, at least - I can repro there, but not on macOS...).

In the task provider sample, it activates with `"onCommand:workbench.action.tasks.runTask"` which sidesteps this issue by ensuring the extension is activated when *any* task is run.

It doesn't make sense for all extensions that have tasks to activate when *any task at all* is run. It's bad for VS Code's performance, and since we [don't have an activation reason](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/44711) we don't know when this happens. VS Code knows the `type` of the commands it's trying to run, and it knows which extensions may be involved (from their manifests).

Ideally, I think VS Code could activate the extensions it knows may be required when it's executing a command. Otherwise, I think we should at least be able to activate on execution of a specific task type (`onTaskType:foo` for ex).

title: Find in selection doesn't work for selection in single line in some cases
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.32.1
- OS Version: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select one line and toggle `Find in selection` (till this point it works fine and searches in the selected line)
2. Reselect another one line in the document and try to use `Find` in that selected line

Expected Result:
Editor should start to search in the newly selected line.

Actual Result:
Editor keeps searching in the previously selected line

Comments:
It works as expected if instead of selecting one line I will select at least two lines.

title: Support using background tasks in dependsOn

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.32.1
- OS Version: 18309

Steps to Reproduce:

create launch.json:
```
{
    // Use IntelliSense to learn about possible attributes.
    // Hover to view descriptions of existing attributes.
    // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [        
        {
            "type": "chrome",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Chrome against localhost",
            "url": "http://localhost:8080",
            "webRoot": "${workspaceFolder}\\src\\FrontEnd\\build",
            "preLaunchTask": "core"
        }
    ]
}
```
2. create task.json:
```
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558 
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "2.0.0",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "label": "core",            
            "type": "npm",
            "script": "start",
            "path": "src/FrontEnd/core/",
            "isBackground": true,
            "dependsOn":["loss"],
            "problemMatcher":{
                "owner": "custom",
                "pattern":[
                    {
                        "regexp": "something not exists",
                        "file": 1,
                        "location": 2,
                        "message": 3
                    }
                ],
                "background": {
                    "activeOnStart": true,
                    "beginsPattern": "core@1.0.0 start",
                    "endsPattern": "created ..\\\\build\\\\vendor.js"
                }
            }
        },
        {
            "label": "loss",            
            "type": "npm",
            "script": "watch",
            "path": "src/FrontEnd/loss/",
            "isBackground": true,            
            "problemMatcher":{
                "owner": "custom",
                "pattern":[
                    {
                        "regexp": "something not exists",
                        "file": 1,
                        "location": 2,
                        "message": 3
                    }
                ],
                "background": {
                    "activeOnStart": true,
                    "beginsPattern": "loss@1.0.0 start",
                    "endsPattern": "waiting for changes"
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

I can use beginsPattern/endsPattern with no issue if I direct launched by preLaunchTask, but if I have DependsOn for same task, it will run the dependencies but can't detect it's status by using endsPattern, the task will hang there. it looks like a bug for me. 

I tried to use the new Terminal: "terminal.integrated.windowsEnableConpty": false/true, no difference. 
I tried to use presentation.panel:"dedicated", no difference. 

I think we have done a nice work on putting tasks running in background and launch, but not those tasks in DependsOn property. 



<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: api to support call hierarchy view
body: This is for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16110, ideas already exist in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/pull/420

title: Provide number of activation of an extension
body: Currently, the number of Download and Installation are really great to evaluate the success of an extension. it would be nice to have also the number of activation of an extension. It will be really convenient when using Extension pack, it will help to know if all extensions of this pack are used or not.

title: Reuse screen space when hiding editor tabs

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Implement a popular request to make better use of vertical screen space.

Fixes #33607

Currently, when hiding editor tabs with the action _"View: Toggle Tab Visibility"_, tabs are not really hidden but rather replaced with a display panel that seems to have strictly less functionality than tabs. This commit ~~changes the behavior~~ [edit: adds a new option] so that tabs are really hidden and the editor gets more vertical screen space. This has been a popular request (issue #33607).

~~I may be missing some rationale behind the current behavior. If that's the case then we may be better off introducing an additional configuration option that lets users define the behavior for hiding tabs. However, I'm not sure how to phrase such an option because I don't understand the motivation behind the current behavior.~~
[edit: the proposed new behavior is now behind a new configuration option "_Workbench > Editor: Show Title Bar_" that is independent of tab/breadcrumb visibility]

* Current layout with tabs (this remains unchanged by the proposed commit):
![current-with-tabs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1719283/54080097-99d9d780-429d-11e9-8f92-b5d9e4f8d698.png)

* Current layout when tabs are hidden [edit: now also unchanged by the new proposal]:
![current-without-tabs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1719283/54080099-a65e3000-429d-11e9-99ce-803cb51a7cc0.png)

* Proposed new layout ~~when tabs are hidden~~  [edit: when "_Workbench > Editor: Show Title Bar_" is set to `false`] as implemented in this commit:
![new-without-tabs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1719283/54080105-c261d180-429d-11e9-9ad9-57320c8e65d3.png)

title: Allow to disable cursor blinking in input boxes
body:
Is there an option to disable cursor blinking in edit fields/input boxes? (such as Find box (ctrl+F), or Find in Files (ctrl+shift+F).
Cursor blinking is set to solid in my config, so the text in the file windows does not blink.
editor.cursorBlinking is set to "block"

However this setting is not applied to edit fields, and it's rather annoying and inconsistent behaviour.
Is there an option to disable cursor blinking in edit fields, too?
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
My current config is:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->

Electron: [3.1.3]
Chrome: 66.0.3359.181
Node.js: 10.2.0
V8: 6.6.346.32
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17763

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Press ctrl+shift+f
2. Type something. The cursor in the edit field will blink.

See image below.
[https://imgur.com/a/wulP9oS](https://imgur.com/a/wulP9oS)

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Pull and Sync  fails when name of tracking branch differs from name of tracked branch on remote

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Issue Type: Bug I have several branches that have another name, or rather path, in the upstream repository, e.g. local branch `foo` pushes to and fetches from branch `path/to/foo` in the upstream repository. But the tracking branch is `upstream/foo`, so the tracking branch path doesn't reflect the upstream branch path. With this setup, the `git.pull` and `git.sync` commands fail with a message "Git: fatal: couldn't find remote ref foo". Studying the code, I found that the bug is either at extensions/git/src/git.ts, lines 1462 - 1470, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/c63c97c12848e85769e717209b73110e83c18ef6/extensions/git/src/git.ts#L1462-L1470 or at extensions/git/src/repository.ts, lines 924, 944 and 1006, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/c63c97c12848e85769e717209b73110e83c18ef6/extensions/git/src/repository.ts#L924 https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/c63c97c12848e85769e717209b73110e83c18ef6/extensions/git/src/repository.ts#L944 https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/c63c97c12848e85769e717209b73110e83c18ef6/extensions/git/src/repository.ts#L1006 Should the `name` field in the `upstream` object really be the name of the remote tracking branch? Shouldn't it be the name of the tracked branch on the remote? Or should the `upstream` object contain another field storing the name of the tracked branch on the remote which then should be used at extensions/git/src/repository.ts, lines 924, 944 and 1006? VS Code version: Code 1.31.1 (1b8e8302e405050205e69b59abb3559592bb9e60, 2019-02-12T02:20:54.427Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134

title: Cannot attach to node process when no folder is opened
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.32.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VSCode.
2. Run `Debug: Attach to Node Process` command, select arbitrary node process.
3. It crashes:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2931520/54074841-e02c3800-4297-11e9-8d7d-2574891299b0.png)


Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled? Not reproducible, since the node debug adapter is also disabled.

title: "Auto-Attach" DebugSession name change after launch

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I am currently implementing something akin to an »auto-attach« feature for `vscode-perl-debug`. When I call `vscode.debug.startDebugging` I do not have a good name for the debug session yet, but once a connection to the debugger is established, I can come up with a better one.

Unfortunately the `DebugSession.name` property is `read-only` and there does not seem to be an alternative to set it post-launch. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug/blob/d490a306164fd086e7e792dec858b1d36a879871/src/node/extension/autoAttach.ts#L62 also uses an awkward name like `Auto attached (123)` it seems.

I do have control over the thread name, but in case of Perl, there is only ever one thread, and I'd rather not have session name and also thread name in the user interface, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/69752.

(Some way to make vscode use the thread name of the single thread in place of the poorly auto-generated session name would work for me.)

title: cursor position incorrect after moving window across screens

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
Issue Type: Bug - Open VS Code - Open and begin to edit a file of any type (tested python, txt, and go). - Type some characters or a sentence, and leave the text cursor indicator at the end. - Use the mouse and move the window in any direction. - observe cursor position has moved, sometimes over the top of a character (instead of between characters) and typed characters appear in a different location Expected result - - after moving the window the cursor stays in the same position and typing occures at the cursor location Note - this is slightly different than BUG #45539, the cursor is not always off by 1 character System note - working with a Surface 2017 (2736x1824 ~15" screen) and a Samsung (2560x1440 ~ 32" widescreen), may be related to the drastically different aspect ratio and pixel sizes VS Code version: Code 1.32.0 (507312a3e3b34b084b467dfd983263bc7c9d87e0, 2019-03-06T18:57:55.589Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134

title: Maximize editor group auto sizing stops working after closing the sidebar

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
When maximizing an editor group and switching between groups, the focused group will maximize. After opening or closing the sidebar, the maximizing stops happening. I have had this happen on linux as well.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
Version information

Version: 1.32.1
Commit: 05f146c7a8f7f78e80261aa3b2a2e642586f9eb3
Date: 2019-03-08T00:15:00.418Z
Electron: 3.1.3
Chrome: 66.0.3359.181
Node.js: 10.2.0
V8: 6.6.346.32
OS: Darwin x64 18.2.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open two tabs and place them in different editor groups
2. Maximize editor group
3. Switching between editor groups makes the focused group maximize
3. Open sidebar
5. Close sidebar
6. Switching between editor groups doesn't maximize focused group.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Gif of bug:

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7032804/54047883-80e5ff00-4195-11e9-970e-e59b81ec9c11.gif)

title: Keybindings: Add when context for if an extension is enabled

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I have different extensions enabled in different workspaces, and similar custom keybindings for those extensions. It would be nice to be able to enable keybindings only if an extension was enabled.

Maybe something like:
When `{extensionId}.enabled == true/false`
